value.title: How to create a storage account and upload a blob | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: UPDATED TO FULL SCREEN  The Azure Portal allows you to create and manage storage accounts and upload a blob. In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to easily create a storage account, upload a blob, and manage the storage account within Storage Explorer (preview).     Try out these

value.title: Is Azure Free Account really free? | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this video of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn how to use Microsoft Azure for free, for 12 months.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips  Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today with Microsoft Azure: http://azure.com/free

value.title: Azure Portal “How To” Series
value.excerpt: Welcome to our weekly series that highlights specific aspects of the Azure portal so you can be more efficient and productive while deploying your cloud workloads from the portal.

topItems.title: How to build tabs and alerts in Azure workbooks | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In workbooks, you can build complex reports but may need a way to segment information in different sections. In this video, you will learn how to build tabs for sections of reports and how to use Azure Monitor Alerts data to integrate into your workbooks.      Try out these features in the Azure portal:
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3XY3lYgrRvA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to easily manage your virtual machine | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about the new virtual machine (VM) overview experience, including new ways to quickly get started using your virtual machine.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vQClJHt2ulQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to use pills to filter in the Azure Portal | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: IIn this episode of the #Azure Portal "How To" series, learn about the new design for pills, how to use them when filtering resources, and how to add and edit pill filters.  Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com   Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XyKh_3NxUlM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to get a visualization view of your resources | Azure Portal Series
topItems.excerpt: In this episode of the #Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to easily view a summary of your resources using different visualizations such as how to view all your resources on a map.   Try out these features in the Azure portal: https://portal.azure.com  Keep connected on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AzurePortal

value.title: AZ-400: Manage source control
value.excerpt: Use GitHub to build a modern source control strategy and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use key GitHub features, including issues, notifications, branches, commits, and pull requests.

topItems.title: Migrate your repository by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to move your existing project to GitHub from a legacy version control system.

topItems.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
topItems.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

topItems.title: Manage repository changes by using pull requests on GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage changes to your repository source by using pull requests.

value.title: Azure SQL fundamentals
value.excerpt: Learn how to deploy, secure, monitor and troubleshoot Azure SQL database.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Azure SQL. Learn about various deployment options and service tiers and what to use for your organization.

topItems.title: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL

topItems.title: Secure your data with Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Secure your data with Azure SQL

topItems.title: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL
topItems.excerpt: Deliver consistent performance with Azure SQL

value.title: Build applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to collaborate with others to continuously build, test, and verify your applications using Azure Pipelines and GitHub.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Implement a code workflow in your build pipeline by using Git and GitHub
topItems.excerpt: Learn along with the Space Game web team the benefits of collaboration through Visual Studio Code and GitHub.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Automate Azure tasks using scripts with PowerShell
value.excerpt: Learn how to install Azure PowerShell on Linux, macOS, or Windows and then connect to Azure and manage your resources.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
value.excerpt: Discover the tools that Azure provides to help you design a secure environment throughout your infrastructure, data, network, and applications.

value.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
value.excerpt: Learn about how to capture trace output from your Azure web apps. View a live log stream and download logs files for offline analysis.

value.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
value.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Deploy and run a containerized web app with Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Discover how to create a Docker image and store it in the Azure Container Registry, then use Azure App Service to deploy a web application based on the image.

value.title: Explore concepts of non-relational data
value.excerpt: Explore concepts of non-relational data

value.title: Fundamentals of network security
value.excerpt: Explore the fundamentals of computer networking security and monitoring.

value.title: Fundamentals of computer networking
value.excerpt: You'll learn the fundamental principles of computer networking to prepare you for the Azure admin and developer learning paths.

value.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure’s role-based access control to effectively manage your team’s access to Azure resources.

value.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data with access keys, secure networks, and Advanced Threat Protection monitoring.

value.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
value.excerpt: Learn about the Site Reliability Engineering approach to the challenge of assuring reliability and gain a better understanding of why it matters.

value.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

value.title: How to get started with Azure API Management | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to get started with Azure API Management, a service that helps protect and manage your APIs.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gA2yxwKo0M0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about using an Azure API gateway to share APIs with partners, and how to use subscription keys to control access to your APIs.

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure API Management to change an API without rewriting code to enable you to apply a caching policy to a GET operation for quicker response.

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: Build automated workflows to integrate data and apps with Azure Logic Apps
value.excerpt: This learning path guides you through creation of serverless workflows for your organization using Azure Logic Apps, a cloud service that automates your business processes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to evaluate Logic Apps as an automation choice for your organization using criteria for integration, performance, conditionals, and connectors.

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Call an API from a Logic Apps workflow using a custom connector
topItems.excerpt: In this module, learn to create a Logic Apps custom connector to call an API from a Logic Apps workflow.

topItems.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
topItems.excerpt: Define a Logic Apps workflow declaratively as a Resource Manager template and deploy the app using the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI).

value.title: Create Intelligent Bots with the Azure Bot Service
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to build a chat bot to interact with customers using text, graphics, or speech with extras from QnA Maker and LUIS.

topItems.title: Build a bot with QnA Maker and Azure Bot Service
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create a bot that answers frequently asked questions.

topItems.excerpt: Describe security concepts and methodologies

topItems.excerpt: Describe Microsoft security and compliance principles

value.title: Get started with blockchain development
value.excerpt: Learn about blockchain and development on the Ethereum platform. Discover what skills you need to begin building your own blockchain networks at scale.

topItems.title: Introduction to blockchain on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Introduction to blockchain on Azure. See how blockchain allows business partners to trust each other's data without a central authority. You'll also learn a bit about how blockchain works. The goal is to help you decide if blockchain is a good choice for your scenario.

topItems.title: Learn how to use Solidity
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Solidity can help you program smart contracts for the Ethereum blockchain platform.

topItems.title: Write Ethereum smart contracts by using Solidity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to install tools that you can use to develop smart contracts.

topItems.title: Create tokens using OpenZeppelin
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the significance of tokens and how they are used in blockchain.

value.title: Analyze receipts with the Form Recognizer service
value.excerpt: Processing invoices and receipts is a common task in many business scenarios. Increasingly, organizations are turning to artificial intelligence (AI) to automate data extraction from scanned receipts.
